definition: one side of one leaf of a book, magazine, etc., or the written or pictorial matter it contains, contact, as with a pager or by calling somebody's name over a P.A. system
details:
noun
- one side of one leaf of a book, magazine, etc., or the written or pictorial matter it contains
= example: one side of one leaf of a book, magazine, etc., or the written or pictorial matter it contains
- in medieval times a youth acting as a knight's attendant as the first stage in training for knighthood
= synonyms: varlet
- a youthful attendant at official functions or ceremonies such as legislative functions and weddings
- a boy who is employed to run errands
= synonyms: pageboy
verb
- contact, as with a pager or by calling somebody's name over a P.A. system
- number the pages of a book or manuscript
= synonyms: foliate
- work as a page
